intro: Paepalanthus flexuosus, commonly known as the flexuous puya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that can range in color from red to orange, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
